result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Johnnie E Bressette

records.addlTxt:
9:30 AM Defendant Johnnie E Bressette in court.  Attorney Daniel Francis Snyder appeared by video for Johnnie E Bressette.  Attorney Ruth Kressel appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Atty, no prelim hearing.  Def waiving right to prelim hearing, understands rights giving up.  Atty is satisfied.  Court is satisfied and accepts the waiver.  Court has reviewed complaint and finds PC that def has committed a felony in Ashland County, case is bound over for arraignment.  State filing information now.  Amended complaint, State the information tracks with amended complaint.  Atty, recv'd complaint, waives reading, pleads NG, noted.
Status conference scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference on December 19, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

records.addlTxt:
9:06 AM Defendant Johnnie E Bressette in court.  Attorney Daniel Francis Snyder appeared by video for Johnnie E Bressette.  Attorney David V. Meany appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Atty has recv'd copy of criminal compliant, waives reading of compliant, retain rights to prelim hearing but waives time limits.  Def waiving time limits for prelim hearing, court accepts waiver.  State comments on scheduling.  Atty no comment on scheduling.  Def can appear by video but would need a stipulation regarding identity.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 14, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Review scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 08:00 am.

Adjourned initial appearance on July 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.

09:28 AM Defendant Johnnie E Bressette in court.  David V. Meany appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Waiting for an atty from SPD  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.
On SPD appointment of counsel report
Adjourned initial appearance on June 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.

10:24 AM Defendant Johnnie E Bressette in court.  David V. Meany appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Def now rec'd compl, given right to an atty. Def would like a SPD atty. Needs to contact SPD ASAP  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Def shall not possess or consume any mind-altering substances meaning alcoholic beverages, controlled substances, inhalants, synthetic marijuana, or similar substances and/or over the counter medications used contrary to label instructions, or prescription medications not taken in compliance with a prescription issued to the defendant.  Def is not to go into any place where mind altering substances are present, maintained, sold or consumed, except defendant may enter a convenience store or grocery store, even if alcohol is sold there.  
Def not to operate any motor vehicle without a valid driver's license
